channel.title: What was your first Guitar tune?
channel.description:
Which riff or song did you learn to play first on a guitar?
The norm is Smoke on the Water however I learnt the riff from [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FI8SUc2SV4k&feature=PlayList&p=DB1F5042086CC656&index=0]Sunshine of your Love[/url] by Cream first.

item.title: What was your first Guitar tune?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Whatever genre you like, how do you expect to play well without knowing what you’re playing?

Read full topic
item.source: What was your first Guitar tune?

item.title: What was your first Guitar tune?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah learning chords and scales may seem stupid but if you ever want to actually become a kick ass guitarist thats what you’ll need to know.

Read full topic
item.source: What was your first Guitar tune?

item.title: What was your first Guitar tune?
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:16, topic:262089”]1. Why would you want to play genres you don’t like?
2. I’m more of a casual player, I only play when I feel like so I’ll never join a band or play with anyone else.
3. Hi.[/quote]

  1. It makes you a better all round player, and more diverse in your playing style. Also, you can bring in techniques from other genres you wouldn’t of thought of otherwise.

  2. Playing with other musicians is extremely invaluable experience, also more fun then playing alone.

Read full topic
item.source: What was your first Guitar tune?

item.title: What was your first Guitar tune?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:15, topic:262089"][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=346152.msg2673936#msg2673936 date=1234961206]
Just a little off-topic: don’t you guys think guitar lessons suck major cockadoodles? I mean, the dude tries to learn me the names of chords and makes me play pop crap. I say piss off.
[/quote]

If you weren’t retarded, you would realise how valuable that will be down the track when you want to play with other guitarists or be able to play genres you don’t usually play.

Also, Unholy Confessions - Avenged Sevenfold :([/quote]

  1. Why would you want to play genres you don’t like?
  2. I’m more of a casual player, I only play when I feel like so I’ll never join a band or play with anyone else.
  3. Hi.

Read full topic
item.source: What was your first Guitar tune?

item.title: What was your first Guitar tune?
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Just a little off-topic: don’t you guys think guitar lessons suck major cockadoodles? I mean, the dude tries to learn me the names of chords and makes me play pop crap. I say piss off.

If you weren’t retarded, you would realise how valuable that will be down the track when you want to play with other guitarists or be able to play genres you don’t usually play.

Also, Unholy Confessions - Avenged Sevenfold

Read full topic
